item.title: What's with these degenerate attracting bikes left all over the streets?, 8th January
item.description:
These bikes are left all over downham. In bushes, front gardens, blocking the pavement, on their stands, chucked on the floor, right next to peoples cars etc Who is responsible for this? Kids riding around on pavements with them as the bikes beeping "Lime bikes beep when they are being ridden without being properly unlocked via the app, usually as a result of a hack or tampering, to signal they are being used illegally and to deter theft" So the future you want is for everyone to use hire bikes and just dump them all over the place, what a lovely society that is leading to.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arcus Road, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dump, 8th January
item.description:
"Reported via mobile in the Fly-Tipping category by at 22:52, Thu 17 April 2025. . . Sent to Lewisham Borough Council less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 7451120. I must have recorded this about five times now? The corner house at this location has about five or six bins, not only are they still blocking the pavement but also, they still do not have lids on the bins so all the rubbish is blown and dragged (foxes) into the road. It's a hazard to drivers, mainly motorcyclist and cyclists" So all that above is from April 2025. The issue still continues. Lewisham council wish to do 20 mph zones, block of residential roads to cars, put up ev charging and bike hire schemes to seem eco friendly but when you actually report about real pollution they don't do anything, strange. If you just continue to send people around with a van to collect it, guess what? The people doing it are like, this is a good spot where we can keep fly tipping because someone is clearing it. Appalling that you will not use CCTV as apparently "obtaining number plates of the vehicles used to fly tip doesn't result in prosecution"

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiftsden Way, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Penton Place dumping of rubbish, 8th January
item.description:
This litter has been piled up for at least a week and seemingly ignored by street cleaners/refuse collectors. The area is increasingly looking like a filthy slum. SO sick of the lack of care and respect.

item.title: 14 Glengall Road, 8th January
item.description:
Always rubbish outside this house and it blocks the pavement, as seen today. Bins are also clearly overflowing. Sofa is dirty too with old fruit so it smells too. Could invite rodents. Not ideal.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glengall Road, London

item.title: Tree suffering from damage and rot, 8th January
item.description:
There is a damaged tree on Southlands Rd substation sub station land. It has decay along its trunk that might make it vulnerable to high winds. It is also behind the friends container. It could cause damage if branches break.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Road, Bickley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox in road, 8th January
Trinity Place, overflow the drainage, 8th January
item.description:
I would like to report a blocked drainage issue on Gully Road. The gully/drain appears to be blocked, which is causing flooding on the road, especially after rainfall. This is creating a hazard for road users and pedestrians, and I would appreciate it if the issue could be inspected and resolved as soon as possible. Please let me know if you need any further information.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Trinity Place, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
